full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
=====================================

### Title
ITB South Roundhead - Canso Canal: Rehabilitation of Marine Structure

### Tender Number
WS3715615899-Doc3715770880

### Tender Type
Request for Proposal (RFP)

### Procurement Method
The government intends to award this contract through a Selective Tendering process.

### Scope of Work
PSPC on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans requires construction services for the rehabilitation of a marine structure at the South Roundhead of the Canso Canal. The scope of work includes, but is not limited to, the replacement of existing suspended slabs and beams, the installation of steel piles to support the new slab structure, and the repair of deteriorated concrete copewalls.

### Estimated Budget
The estimated cost of this procurement is between $500,000 and $1,000,000.

### Contracting Entity
The solicitation is being conducted by the Department of Public Works and Government Services, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans.

### Closing Date
Please note that the closing time for this bid has been amended to 2:00 p.m. AST on November 8th, 2022. All bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive.

### Contact Information
For any inquiries, please contact Alex Russell at [alex.russell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:alex.russell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).

### Associated Documents
No attachments are available for this tender.

### Agreement
This contract is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and will be delivered in Nova Scotia. 

### Language of Tender
Both English and French are official languages of this Request for Proposal and the tender must be submitted in one of these languages. Note that translation assistance is available to respondents upon request.  

The reference, amendment and tender numbers, closing date, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the UNSPC code (72152700) are below:

* amendment number: 2
* tender number: WS3715615899
* tender closing date: November 8th, 2022, at 2:00 p.m. AST
* UNSPC code: 72152700
